docs.lead_paragraph: A mathematical formula cannot identify pairs of singles likely to have a successful romance.

headline.seo: Online Dating Sites Don’t Match Hype
headline.main: The Dubious Science of Online Dating
headline.print_headline: The Dubious Science of Online Dating

docs.abstract: Gray Matter column by social psychology professors Eli J Finkel and Benjamin R Karney argues that the past 80 years of scientific research about what makes people romantically compatible suggests that it is unlikely that dating Web sites use scientifically sound methods to match potential partners, as they claim to.
docs.snippet: A mathematical formula cannot identify pairs of singles likely to have a successful romance.

keywords.value: Psychological Science in the Public Interest
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By ELI J. FINKEL AND BENJAMIN R. KARNEY

docs.lead_paragraph: Although Archbishop Timothy M. Dolan has been leading the fight against requirements for insurance coverage of birth control, Catholic health institutions, including those in his own diocese, have for 10 years complied with law.

headline.seo: Catholic Institutions Reluctantly Comply With N.Y. Contraceptives Law
headline.main: N.Y. Law on Contraceptives Already in Place, and Catholic Institutions Comply
headline.print_headline: Catholic Institutions Reluctantly Obey New York Law on Contraceptives Coverage

docs.abstract: Some New York Roman Catholic organizations have been grudgingly complying with a state law for 10 years that mandates that religiously affiliated institutions cover birth control in their insurance plans; Archbishop Timothy M Dolan of New York has been leading the fight against a similar national requirement.
docs.snippet: Although Archbishop Timothy M. Dolan has been leading the fight against requirements for insurance coverage of birth control, Catholic health institutions, including those in his own diocese, have for 10 years complied with law.

byline.original: By JOSEPH BERGER and THOMAS KAPLAN

headline.main: Should Obama Have His Own Plan B?

docs.abstract: What the Obama administration should do about the controversy over contraception, health care and Catholic institutions.
docs.snippet: What the Obama administration should do about the controversy over contraception, health care and Catholic institutions.

byline.original: By DAVID BROOKS and GAIL COLLINS

docs.lead_paragraph: Gail Collins: David, I was kind of glad to discover that we have a disagreement about President Obama's decision to require Catholic hospitals and universities to cover contraceptives in their health insurance plans. Generally, when the topic turns to sex - gay marriage, abortion rights - we're pretty much on the same page. That makes for boring conversations.

headline.main: Should Obama Have His Own Plan B?

docs.abstract: What the Obama administration should do about the controversy over contraception, health care and Catholic institutions.
docs.snippet: What the Obama administration should do about the controversy over contraception, health care and Catholic institutions.
